enumeratedValue.name: Sync
enumeratedValue.description: The effect of an event on the trigger input (TRGI) is delayed to allow a perfect synchronization between the current timer and its slaves (through TRGO). It is useful if we want to synchronize several timers on a single external event.

enumeratedValue.name: Disabled
enumeratedValue.description: Slave mode disabled - if CEN = â€˜1 then the prescaler is clocked directly by the internal clock.

enumeratedValue.name: Encoder_Mode_1
enumeratedValue.description: Encoder mode 1 - Counter counts up/down on TI2FP1 edge depending on TI1FP2 level.

enumeratedValue.name: Encoder_Mode_2
enumeratedValue.description: Encoder mode 2 - Counter counts up/down on TI1FP2 edge depending on TI2FP1 level.

enumeratedValue.name: Encoder_Mode_3
enumeratedValue.description: Encoder mode 3 - Counter counts up/down on both TI1FP1 and TI2FP2 edges depending on the level of the other input.

enumeratedValue.name: Reset_Mode
enumeratedValue.description: Reset Mode - Rising edge of the selected trigger input (TRGI) reinitializes the counter and generates an update of the registers.

enumeratedValue.name: Gated_Mode
enumeratedValue.description: Gated Mode - The counter clock is enabled when the trigger input (TRGI) is high. The counter stops (but is not reset) as soon as the trigger becomes low. Both start and stop of the counter are controlled.

enumeratedValue.name: Trigger_Mode
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger Mode - The counter starts at a rising edge of the trigger TRGI (but it is not reset). Only the start of the counter is controlled.

enumeratedValue.name: Ext_Clock_Mode
enumeratedValue.description: External Clock Mode 1 - Rising edges of the selected trigger (TRGI) clock the counter.

enumeratedValue.description: The counter value has been captured in TIMx_CCRx register while CCxIF flag was already set

enumeratedValue.name: CounterOnly
enumeratedValue.description: Only counter overflow/underflow generates an update interrupt or DMA request

enumeratedValue.name: Update
enumeratedValue.description: Re-initializes the timer counter and generates an update of the reigsters.

enumeratedValue.name: EdgeAligned
enumeratedValue.description: The counter counts up or down depending on the direction bit

enumeratedValue.name: CenterAligned1
enumeratedValue.description: The counter counts up and down alternatively. Output compare interrupt flags are set only when the counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: CenterAligned2
enumeratedValue.description: The counter counts up and down alternatively. Output compare interrupt flags are set only when the counter is counting up.

enumeratedValue.name: CenterAligned3
enumeratedValue.description: The counter counts up and down alternatively. Output compare interrupt flags are set both when the counter is counting up or down.

enumeratedValue.name: Disabled
enumeratedValue.description: Counter is not stopped at update event

enumeratedValue.name: Enabled
enumeratedValue.description: Counter stops counting at the next update event (clearing the CEN bit)

enumeratedValue.name: AnyEvent
enumeratedValue.description: Any of counter overflow/underflow, setting UG, or update through slave mode, generates an update interrupt or DMA request

enumeratedValue.name: CounterOnly
enumeratedValue.description: Only counter overflow/underflow generates an update interrupt or DMA request

enumeratedValue.name: Normal
enumeratedValue.description: The TIMx_CH1 pin is connected to TI1 input

enumeratedValue.name: XOR
enumeratedValue.description: The TIMx_CH1, CH2, CH3 pins are connected to TI1 input

enumeratedValue.name: Reset
enumeratedValue.description: The UG bit from the TIMx_EGR register is used as trigger output

enumeratedValue.name: Enable
enumeratedValue.description: The counter enable signal, CNT_EN, is used as trigger output

enumeratedValue.name: Update
enumeratedValue.description: The update event is selected as trigger output

enumeratedValue.name: ComparePulse
enumeratedValue.description: The trigger output send a positive pulse when the CC1IF flag it to be set, as soon as a capture or a compare match occurred

enumeratedValue.name: CompareOC1
enumeratedValue.description: OC1REF signal is used as trigger output

enumeratedValue.name: CompareOC2
enumeratedValue.description: OC2REF signal is used as trigger output

enumeratedValue.name: CompareOC3
enumeratedValue.description: OC3REF signal is used as trigger output

enumeratedValue.name: CompareOC4
enumeratedValue.description: OC4REF signal is used as trigger output

enumeratedValue.name: OnCompare
enumeratedValue.description: CCx DMA request sent when CCx event occurs

enumeratedValue.name: OnUpdate
enumeratedValue.description: CCx DMA request sent when update event occurs

enumeratedValue.name: NotInverted
enumeratedValue.description: ETR is noninverted, active at high level or rising edge

enumeratedValue.name: Inverted
enumeratedValue.description: ETR is inverted, active at low level or falling edge

enumeratedValue.name: Enabled
enumeratedValue.description: External clock mode 2 enabled. The counter is clocked by any active edge on the ETRF signal.

enumeratedValue.name: NoFilter
enumeratedValue.description: No filter, sampling is done at fDTS

enumeratedValue.name: Sync
enumeratedValue.description: The effect of an event on the trigger input (TRGI) is delayed to allow a perfect synchronization between the current timer and its slaves (through TRGO). It is useful if we want to synchronize several timers on a single external event.

enumeratedValue.name: Disabled
enumeratedValue.description: Slave mode disabled - if CEN = â€˜1 then the prescaler is clocked directly by the internal clock.

enumeratedValue.name: Encoder_Mode_1
enumeratedValue.description: Encoder mode 1 - Counter counts up/down on TI2FP1 edge depending on TI1FP2 level.

enumeratedValue.name: Encoder_Mode_2
enumeratedValue.description: Encoder mode 2 - Counter counts up/down on TI1FP2 edge depending on TI2FP1 level.

enumeratedValue.name: Encoder_Mode_3
enumeratedValue.description: Encoder mode 3 - Counter counts up/down on both TI1FP1 and TI2FP2 edges depending on the level of the other input.

enumeratedValue.name: Reset_Mode
enumeratedValue.description: Reset Mode - Rising edge of the selected trigger input (TRGI) reinitializes the counter and generates an update of the registers.

enumeratedValue.name: Gated_Mode
enumeratedValue.description: Gated Mode - The counter clock is enabled when the trigger input (TRGI) is high. The counter stops (but is not reset) as soon as the trigger becomes low. Both start and stop of the counter are controlled.

enumeratedValue.name: Trigger_Mode
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger Mode - The counter starts at a rising edge of the trigger TRGI (but it is not reset). Only the start of the counter is controlled.

enumeratedValue.name: Ext_Clock_Mode
enumeratedValue.description: External Clock Mode 1 - Rising edges of the selected trigger (TRGI) clock the counter.

enumeratedValue.name: Overcapture
enumeratedValue.description: The counter value has been captured in TIMx_CCRx register while CCxIF flag was already set

enumeratedValue.name: Match
enumeratedValue.description: If CC1 is an output: The content of the counter TIMx_CNT matches the content of the TIMx_CCR1 register. If CC1 is an input: The counter value has been captured in TIMx_CCR1 register.

enumeratedValue.name: Trigger
enumeratedValue.description: The TIF flag is set in TIMx_SR register. Related interrupt or DMA transfer can occur if enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: Trigger
enumeratedValue.description: If CC1 is an output: CC1IF flag is set, Corresponding interrupt or DMA request is sent if enabled. If CC1 is an input: The current value of the counter is captured in TIMx_CCR1 register.

enumeratedValue.name: Update
enumeratedValue.description: Re-initializes the timer counter and generates an update of the reigsters.

enumeratedValue.name: Frozen
enumeratedValue.description: The comparison between the output compare register TIMx_CCRy and the counter TIMx_CNT has no effect on the outputs

enumeratedValue.name: ActiveOnMatch
enumeratedValue.description: Set channel to active level on match. OCyREF signal is forced high when the counter matches the capture/compare register

enumeratedValue.name: InactiveOnMatch
enumeratedValue.description: Set channel to inactive level on match. OCyREF signal is forced low when the counter matches the capture/compare register

enumeratedValue.name: PwmMode1
enumeratedValue.description: In upcounting, channel is active as long as TIMx_CNT<TIMx_CCRy else inactive. In downcounting, channel is inactive as long as TIMx_CNT>TIMx_CCRy else active

enumeratedValue.name: Disabled
enumeratedValue.description: Preload register on CCR2 disabled. New values written to CCR2 are taken into account immediately

enumeratedValue.name: Enabled
enumeratedValue.description: Preload register on CCR2 enabled. Preload value is loaded into active register on each update event
